abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column looks at Oklahoma University Sooner's core four players, Buddy Hield, Isaiah Cousins, Ryan Spangler and Jordan Woodard, who have started 105 games together; fact that all four players, who led Sooners to within two victories of championship, have stayed together for so long is unusual in college basketball, where most players stick around for one year before heading off to play for NBA.
lead_paragraph: The Sooners played their way into the Final Four by relying on four upperclassmen who started 105 straight games together, unusual in the one-and-done era.

headline.print_headline: A Familiar Look, Now Rarely Seen
headline.main: Oklahoma Has a Familiar Look, Now Rarely Seen

snippet: The Sooners played their way into the Final Four by relying on four upperclassmen who started 105 straight games together, unusual in the one-and-done era....
